column4: Hi, folks.  Got a question about adding Ubuntu 7.10 to a Suse 10sp1 box and dualbooting?  Can you help?
if you want to leave the suse bootloader in tact u can install ubuntu and then grub to the install partition NOT the mbr, then manueally edit the grub.conf of suse to chain load the ubuntu set p
has te advantage that both distros can update grub independently without messing up the other
